notes_translated.fr: Cet ensemble de donnees indique le nombre quotidien moyen d'hommes et de femmes places en detention au Centre de detention d'Ottawa-Carleton de l'exercice 2005-2006 a l'exercice 2017-2018. Les nombres quotidiens moyens sont repartis en fonction des six statuts de detention suivants : * Peine federale/Violation des modalites de la liberation conditionnelle * Detention pour un motif lie a l'immigration * Sejour discontinu (fins de semaine) * Detention provisoire * Peine provinciale de moins de deux ans * Autres statuts Pour en savoir plus, consultez la page Groupe d'examen concernant le Centre de detention d'Ottawa-Carleton [analyse des tendances trimestrielles](http://www.mcscs.jus.gov.on.ca/french/Servicescorrectionnels/OCDCGroupedexamenconcernant%E2%80%93Analysedestendancestrimestrielles_fr.html). Volets connexes au present jeu de donnees : * [Alertes à l’admission au Centre de détention d’Ottawa-Carleton](/fr/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-admissions-alerts) * [Admissions en detention au Centre de detention d'Ottawa-Carleton](/fr/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-admissions-to-custody) * [Nombre de detenus dans les unites specialisees du Centre de detention d'Ottawa-Carleton](/fr/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-utilization-rates) * [Taux d'utilisation du Centre de detention d'Ottawa-Carleton](/fr/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-specialized-unit-hold-counts)
notes_translated.en: This dataset provides the average daily count of male and female inmates being held in the Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre covering fiscal years 2005-06 through to 2017-18. Average daily counts are broken into six average counts: * Federal sentence of two years or more/national parole violation * Immigration hold * Intermittent days stay (weekend days) * Remand * Provincial sentence of less than two years * Other hold statuses than those listed For more information, please see the Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre [Quarterly Trends Analysis](http://www.mcscs.jus.gov.on.ca/english/Corrections/OttawaCarletonDetentionCentreTaskForce/OCDCTaskForce%E2%80%93QuarterlyTrendsAnalysis.html). This dataset is related to the following: * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre admissions alerts](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-admissions-alerts) * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre admissions to custody](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-admissions-to-custody) * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre utilization rates](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-utilization-rates) * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre specialized unit hold counts](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-specialized-unit-hold-counts)

notes: This dataset provides the average daily count of male and female inmates being held in the Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre covering fiscal years 2005-06 through to 2017-18. Average daily counts are broken into six average counts: * Federal sentence of two years or more/national parole violation * Immigration hold * Intermittent days stay (weekend days) * Remand * Provincial sentence of less than two years * Other hold statuses than those listed For more information, please see the Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre [Quarterly Trends Analysis](http://www.mcscs.jus.gov.on.ca/english/Corrections/OttawaCarletonDetentionCentreTaskForce/OCDCTaskForce%E2%80%93QuarterlyTrendsAnalysis.html). This dataset is related to the following: * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre admissions alerts](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-admissions-alerts) * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre admissions to custody](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-admissions-to-custody) * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre utilization rates](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-utilization-rates) * [Ottawa-Carleton Detention Centre specialized unit hold counts](/dataset/ottawa-carleton-detention-centre-specialized-unit-hold-counts)
